oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-11-11 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 11, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Sam & Kirk McGee, Slim Smith, and Ford Rush. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Sam & Kirk McGee; Slim Smith; Ford Rush
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified fiddle tune, test band] (excerpt) -- Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Old Joe Clark (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- Honest Confession Is Good For The Soul (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Sam & Kirk McGee and Slim Smith -- Tennessee Mountain Fox Chase (Sam & Kirk McGee, Slim Smith) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- You're The Only Star In My Blue Heaven (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Sam & Kirk McGee and Slim Smith -- Listen To The Mockingbird (Sam & Kirk McGee, Slim Smith) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Wabash Cannonball (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Macon, Dorris; Sam & Kirk McGee (Musical group); McGee, Sam, 1894-1975; McGee, Kirk, 1899-1983; Smith, Slim
